heisigStory: Running, we are told here, mends the soil. Observe in the following frames how this kanji can embrace other elements from below, much the same way as the element for road does; and how, in order to do this, the final stroke needs to be lengthened.
hint: chạy. đất bẻ cong người để chạy
koohiiStory1: Hint: This kanji is NOT soil on top of mend, as Heisig claims - that would duplicate one of the strokes. Instead, it is 10 on top of mend. So my story is: If you run 10 miles, you will need to mend your socks!
koohiiStory2: The sports ground needs MENDING after the game as the players have been RUNNING around which has caused the ground to be chopped up.
myStory: chạy. đất bẻ cong người để chạy
words: running a wheeled vehicle (e.g. car), traveling
